title: Sir Phil Redmond calls for soaps to 'tackle the real social issues'
description: The creator of Brookside and Grange Hill calls for more gritty soap storylines as he is knighted.

title: Laura Kuenssberg challenges PM over new restrictions
description: Amid the fallout from the Christmas party row, Boris Johnson is asked how he can tell people they must now follow new instructions.

title: Downing Street party: Who is Allegra Stratton and why has she quit?
description: A profile of the woman who has resigned over unguarded comments about a No 10 lockdown party in a video.

title: Downing Street Christmas Party: Public react to leaked video
description: Yesterday a video was leaked of No 10 staff joking about holding a Christmas party.

title: Don't Look Up: Mixed reviews for Leonardo DiCaprio satire
description: Jennifer Lawrence and Leonardo DiCaprio's film has been called "ambitious" but lacking in comedy.

title: Allegra Stratton quits: Watch her tearful apology after No 10 Christmas party video
description: Watch as PM adviser Allegra Stratton offers her "profound apologies" after the leaked video of party remarks.

title: Covid: Bereaved family angry at No 10 lockdown party
description: Mavis Doreen D'Arcy died alone in hospital in Hull, with her family given a single hospital visit.

title: Covid-19: Vaccinating a city where uptake is low
description: Almost a third of the population of Peterborough have not received their first Covid-19 jab.

title: Omicron: How do you detect it?
description: Swabs from PCR tests can help identify omicron, but genetic analysis is needed to confirm it.

title: Grenfell firm F1 sponsorship deal ended
description: Mercedes' sponsorship deal with Kingspan, a firm that made insulation material involved in the Grenfell Tower disaster, is ended a week after its announcement.

title: PM sorry for offence caused by party joke video
description: Boris Johnson says he was given assurances that no party had taken place and no Covid rules were broken.

title: Tiny town, Marazion, bids to become UK's smallest city
description: The bid for Marazion in Cornwall is part of the Queen's Platinum Jubilee celebrations.

title: Germany's Olaf Scholz takes over from Merkel as chancellor
description: Olaf Scholz is sworn in as chancellor, leading a three-party coalition after 16 years of Merkel rule.

title: 'Euros' is most googled term of 2021 in UK
description: The three most searched for terms on Google UK this year were football-related.

title: Covid booster jab booking system opens to over-40s in England
description: Another seven million people will be able to book their top up jab, including those in at-risk groups.

title: Halo Infinite: Time to 'mix-up' the series
description: How some of the brains behind Halo: Infinite developed it in a fast-changing gaming landscape.

title: Hamilton v Verstappen - the key moments of a thrilling season
description: BBC Sport looks back on the key moments of a memorable F1 season as Lewis Hamilton and Max Verstappen prepare for a thrilling finale.

title: Australia 'surprised' by Broad omission for first Ashes Test
description: Australia were "surprised" that England left bowler Stuart Broad out for the first Ashes Test at The Gabba in Brisbane, says captain Pat Cummins.

title: Bipin Rawat: India's top general in helicopter crash
description: Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat was in the helicopter which crashed in southern India.

title: Storm Barra: Power cuts hit north and north east Scotland
description: About 1,000 homes in north and north east Scotland are left without electricity as extreme weather again disrupts the network.

title: Olaf Scholz: Who is Germany's new chancellor?
description: The centre-left leader was vice-chancellor and succeeds Angela Merkel after securing a coalition deal.

title: The Ashes: England bowled out for 147 by Australia on day one at the Gabba
description: England's Ashes campaign begins in depressingly familiar fashion as the tourists are skittled for just 147 by Australia on the opening day of the series.

title: Sports Personality 2021: Contenders for award to be revealed on 13 December
description: The contenders for BBC Sports Personality of the Year 2021 will be revealed on Monday, 13 December at 08:30 GMT.

title: The Ashes: Australia dominate England on day one at the Gabba - highlights
description: England get their Ashes campaign off to a poor start as Australia bowl them out for just 147 on the opening day of the series at the Gabba.

title: ‘Why Henry Cavill is right about Warhammer’
description: Radio 1 Newsbeat hears from superfans of the war game, after the actor spoke about his love for it.

title: Covid: Vaccines should work against Omicron variant, WHO says
description: A small study in South Africa suggests the new variant could partially evade the Pfizer jab.

title: The Papers: No 10 'party clowns' and 'a sick joke'
description: Wednesday's headlines focus on a video of No 10 staff joking about a party in Downing Street last year.

title: The Ashes: Australia captain Pat Cummins takes fifth wicket to bowl England out for 147
description: Australia captain Pat Cummins dismisses Chris Woakes to complete a five-wicket haul as England are dismissed for 147 on the first day of the first Ashes Test at the Gabba.

title: Fish ‘whoops and growls’ recorded on restored reef
description: Recordings of fish 'whooping, croaking and growling' reveal reef coming back to life, scientists say.

title: The ‘gals’ behind Samoa’s first woman PM
description: Samoa's first woman prime minister has been supported throughout her career by a group of powerful female friends.

title: How Bangladeshis are lured into slavery in Libya
description: A 19-year-old tells of his harrowing ordeal at the hands of traffickers who tricked him and his parents.

title: The Ashes: Rory Burns is bowled first ball by Mitchell Starc
description: England's Rory Burns is bowled by Mitchell Starc with the first ball of the first Ashes Test at the Gabba.

title: Indonesia's biodiesel drive is leading to deforestation
description: Indonesia aims to use biofuels to cut greenhouse gas emissions, but it may damage its forests in the process.

title: Christmas movie production snowballs to reach new record
description: The number of new festive films listed for release in 2021 is four times higher than a decade ago.

title: 100 Women: The former child refugee helping Afghan asylum seekers
description: Former child refugee Rehana Popal now helps Afghans with asylum applications.

title: Afghanistan: Girls' despair as Taliban confirm secondary school ban
description: The BBC hears about the ban's harmful impact from teachers and students in 13 Afghan provinces.

title: FIA boss: Electric F1 racing is 'simply not possible'
description: With Formula One race distance at 200 miles, switching to electric vehicles remains a long way off.

title: CEO Secrets: 'Call centre work trained me to be a CEO'
description: Steven Bartlett, the 29-year-old co-founder of Social Chain, shares his business advice.

title: Throwing a tea party for children with cancer
description: Charity Spread a Smile has put on a tea party for seriously ill children who spent lockdown in hospital.

title: Reverse advent calendar: A simple idea helping Australians at Christmas
description: After starting her own reverse advent calendar to help others, Heather Luttrell took the idea nationwide.
